column2: text
I may be destined for the iron mask, but I accept.
May the Shadows of Hashut hide my dishonour!
It pains me to treat with the likes of you, very well.
You have a choice to make, serve as a slave or pay the Dawi Zharr.
It is lucky for you that you have something I want.
The strong take from the weak, it will go easier on you if it is willing.
The Great Skull Land is littered with the bodies of those who denied me.
I would rather join the Infernal Guard!
You insult my pride!
Only a slave would accept such a deal!
Do not mistake me for a worshipper of the Ruinous Powers, we are the Children of Hashut.
You look like one of my slaves!
Oh look, one of the lesser races wishes to speak with me.
By the grace of Hashut, yes!
Excellent!  I shall sacrifice many slaves in celebration!
We control the trade routes to the east, but such a thing is expensive, deserving of compensation.
We are as old as the mountains, trust in our judgment
Hashut knows we stick to our deals.
Many are the deals we have made, whether to buy or to sell, this should be another.
You speak well, but I am not convinced.
I do not see the benefit for us in this.
I must listen to the will of the Bull God, this is not it.
Ah, you!  You I can stand.
The Children of Hashut bid you welcome.
You have the ear of the Dawi Zharr.
Not the best trade I have ever made, but very well.
I suppose an ogre would accept this.
The Sorcerer-Prophets will be pleased.
We are glad to see you recognize the majesty of the Dawi Zharr.
This will advance my standing in the Tower of Zharr, my thanks.
You show great promise for a lesser being.
Our relations will be very profitable I imagine.
May Hashut bless you.
If you wish to be a fool, so be it.
Only the Father of Darkness is true to his word.
Just like the Ancestor Gods at the dawn of the Dawi Zharr.
You insult the Chosen of Hashut!
May the Sorcerer's Curse afflict you!
It seems you do not know a good deal when you see one.
So be it, the mines are in need of new slaves.
The Legions of Azgorh will be unleashed!
We have weathered the wrath of gods, you are nothing in comparison.
This is no longer beneficial to the Dawi Zharr.
The Sorcerer-Prophets have spoken.
I see no further profit in this.
Sacrifices must be made if you wish to continue our relations.
We did not recover our numbers by risking the Children of Hashut in battle unnecessarily.
The slavemasters are ready for this conflict, are you?
Hellcannons are not cheap to make.
We can do business if you can.
Do you require a staring contest with Rykarth before you accept?
We do not need the honeyed words of the Lammasu to make this offer.
We have no need of lesser races.
I still have my pride.
If I needed that, I would let you know.
Trust does not come easy to us since the Ancestors abandoned us.
We are more used to enslaving those we need, but we can try this.
If we can work with Ironskin ogres, we can work with you.
The Dawi Zharr are too few in number for this.
There is no profit in this conflict any longer.
Hashut has counselled me in this.
There are many slaves to be taken in this conflict, if you will have us.
Do you wish the aid of the Dawi Zharr?
We have war machines that require field testing.
Yes, we are more generous than the average Dawi.
All gifts come with a price, perhaps one day we will have need of you.
A sample of our wares, let us know if you want more.  Armour, weapons, cannons . . . mechanical boars.
You have my attention . . . for now.
We have treated with all sorts, we can treat with you.
I suppose I have time for this.
We may not have a Dammaz Kron, but there is unsettled business between us all the same.
You are chattel, and I do not make deals with chattel.
The fires of war have not yet burnt out.
The Children of Hashut stand alone in this world.
Our loyalty is to the Bull God alone!
What do you take us for?  Dwarfs?
I have need of slaves, you look suitable!
Behold the fury of Hashut, Father of Darkness, God of Fire, Greed and Tyranny!
The furnace beneath the statue of Hashut requires sacrifices!
